docs.snippet: After broadcasting himself dangling the girl by the neck from a building on the resort island of Phuket, the man killed himself, the police said.

headline.main: Father in Thailand Kills 11-Month-Old Daughter Live on Facebook

docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on whether to tell a friend’s employer about his racist post, what to do about construction you suspect may be illegal and how to deal with the scofflaws at your gym.

headline.print_headline: Do I Report a Teacher’s Racist Facebook Post?
headline.main: Do I Report a Teacher’s Racist Facebook Post?

docs.snippet: The social network is facing criticism for a posting of a killing, but it is not the first struggle the company has had over content.
Also: outrage at a baby shower hosted by a mother-to-be; the case of the missing blender; and a forgotten salad order arouses suspicions of dementia.

headline.main: My Friend Uses Too Much Botox. May I Tell Her?

docs.snippet: The case was viewed as a test of social media companies’ ability to push back on information requests from prosecutors.

headline.print_headline: Top State Court Deals Facebook a Setback
headline.main: Facebook Loses Appeal to Block Bulk Search Warrants

docs.snippet: The Breakdown: conversation starters and context, drawn from the day’s news in Australia.

headline.main: Senator Resigns Over Dual Citizenship. Also: Facebook Rejects Turnbull on Decryption.

docs.snippet: The hunt continued for Steve Stephens, who officials said posted on Facebook a video of him fatally shooting a man in Cleveland on Sunday.

headline.main: Nationwide Search and $50,000 Reward in Manhunt for Suspect in Fatal Shooting Shown on Facebook

docs.snippet: Facebook’s chief, Mark Zuckerberg, realized early that creating the best new features is not as important as owning the biggest and most engaged network.

headline.print_headline: Copy and Conquer: Facebook Wins Again
headline.main: Why Facebook Keeps Beating Every Rival: It’s the Network, of Course

docs.snippet: Reports about the tech giant’s bullying of the New America Foundation raise concerns about how it shapes policy debates.

headline.main: Google’s Disturbing Influence Over Think Tanks

docs.snippet: With the police seeking to arrest him in the robbery of a cabdriver, Jamel Chandler used Facebook’s video streaming service to share what proved to be his last moments.

headline.print_headline: Live Facebook Video Precedes a Fatal Fall in Brooklyn
headline.main: Before Fatal Fall, Man Fleeing Police Broadcasts Facebook Video
